Hazardous waste gone to landfill is all waste generated from the medical sector so is partly hazardous material but not all hazardous. The specific amount of how much medical waste is hazardous is unknown.

Classification of waste by classes of hazard is done in accordance with the relevant legislation of RA and the Classifier, which was last amended in 2010. That's why the indicators for the years preceding 2010 and the years following 2010 are not compatible.

The big amount of hazardous waste landfilled in 2001 is because  of  the accumulation of Spent pot lining waste generated by ALBA for ten years ( 1991-2001), which was disposed at the landfill site (which started operation on 28th February 2001). Thus, all stockpiled SPL was sent by ALBA to the landfill site during 2001.
95% of total collected hazarous waste.

The figures partially consider utilization or disposal of waste accumulated during previous years. Besides, hazardous waste treated or disposed during the year includes hazardous waste exported during the year.

Calculation of Iraq's environmental survey indicators for 2010 (water - sewerage - municipal services) represents the sum of hazardous waste collected and disposed of by (collection at temporary ad hoc sites, landfill in landfill sites and dumping in empty yards).
Data refer to acceptable hazardous wastes for landfilling such as asbestos, Clinical wastes and surgical waste. Data submitted are provisional.
The amount deposited in landfill is equal to the sum of the amounts deposited in landfill directly and the ones the ones deposited in landfill after treatment.
